meanings.sent1: She accidentally rumpled her paper while trying to fold it neatly.
meanings.sent2: The wind began to rumple the leaves on the trees.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous puppy would rumple up any blanket left on the floor.
meanings.sent4: Time seemed to rumple the once smooth surface of the pond.
meanings.sent5: The child's fingers would always rumple the pages of his favorite book.

meanings.sent1: After playing outside, his clothes were rumpled and dirty.
meanings.sent2: The strong wind would rumple her hair as she walked along the beach.
meanings.sent3: The playful kittens would rumple up the clean laundry every time.
meanings.sent4: The storm would rumple the calm surface of the lake, creating waves.
meanings.sent5: The careless guest managed to rumple the carefully arranged tablecloth.
